remarks: A function is bijective if a "retraction" and a "section" exist, see comments for ~ fcof1 and ~ fcofo .  Formerly part of proof of ~ fcof1o .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)
statement:
fcof1od.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
fcof1od.g $e |- ( ph -> G : B --> A ) $.
fcof1od.a $e |- ( ph -> ( G o. F ) = ( _I |` A ) ) $.
fcof1od.b $e |- ( ph -> ( F o. G ) = ( _I |` B ) ) $.
fcof1od $p |- ( ph -> F : A -1-1-onto-> B ) $.
